Theorem 3.4.15 (Principle of Inclusion Exclusion Generalized)
If (Ai)1≤i≤nare ﬁnite sets, then:
\sum_{i=1}^{n}|A_i| - \sum_{i<j}|A_i \cap A_j| + \sum_{i<j<k}|A_i \cap A_j \cap A_k| - \cdots + (-1)^{n-1}|A_1 \cap \cdots \cap A_n|
question: Using the generalized principle of inclusion-exclusion, express the formula for the union of \( n \) sets.
solution:
The generalized principle of inclusion-exclusion states that for \( n \) finite sets \( A_i \):

\[
|A_1 \cup A_2 \cup \cdots \cup A_n| = \sum_{i=1}^{n}|A_i| - \sum_{i<j}|A_i \cap A_j| + \sum_{i<j<k}|A_i \cap A_j \cap A_k| - \cdots + (-1)^{n-1}|A_1 \cap \cdots \cap A_n|
\]

This formula accounts for the overlaps among the sets to avoid double counting.
